org.x2d.zuul
Class Item

java.lang.Object
  org.x2d.zuul.Item
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleItem
public abstract class Item
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Abstract class representing an item. Methods should be overridden if the new class should do scriptet stuff. As an example: 

new Item("some name", "a description of the item") {
    @Override
    public boolean isUsable() {
        return true;
    }
    @Override
    public void use(Game g) {
        //Something that should happen when this item is used.
    }
};

See Also:

description - A short description of the item.
text - A text that should be used when the item is read.
isTakable - Should be true if the item could be put into the backpack else false

use

public abstract void use(Game g)
This method should be called when the item is used.

Parameters:
g - The game which this item should interact with

isUsable

public abstract boolean isUsable()
Checks if it's possible to use this item. This should return true if there is an use method.

Returns:
true if it is possible to use this item else false
